chapter.tagline: Establishing the believer in the power of speaking God’s Word to sustain revelation and victory.

questions.a: It is the declaration of what God has said concerning you. Faith speaks in agreement with divine truth, not circumstances.

questions.q: Why is confession necessary for believers?
questions.a: Because faith is voiced. Believing alone doesn’t complete faith—confession seals it. The Word must be spoken to manifest results.

questions.q: What is the difference between confession and prayer?
questions.a: Prayer asks; confession declares. Prayer seeks God’s intervention; confession affirms what He has already done.

questions.q: How does confession relate to salvation?
questions.a: Romans 10:9 shows salvation is received by believing and confessing. What is believed in the heart must be confessed with the mouth.

questions.q: Can wrong confessions affect a believer’s life?
questions.a: Absolutely. Words frame experience. Wrong confession empowers defeat; right confession sustains victory.

questions.q: How often should believers make faith confessions?
questions.a: Continually. Faith must stay vocal; consistent confession keeps the heart aligned with truth and silences doubt.

questions.q: What is the relationship between confession and renewal of the mind?
questions.a: Confession reinforces new creation realities in consciousness. As the mouth speaks, the mind aligns, transforming perception.

questions.q: Does confession create or reveal reality?
questions.a: It doesn’t create truth; it enforces it. Confession manifests spiritual reality in the natural by giving voice to divine law.

questions.q: What role does the Holy Spirit play in confession?
questions.a: He is the power behind the spoken Word. When you confess, the Spirit gives life to your words, producing manifestation.

questions.q: Why must faith confessions continue even after manifestation?
questions.a: Because confession is not just for obtaining—it’s for maintaining. Constant affirmation keeps the believer established in victory.
